text: - Hello and welcome

to another AWS customer
success story video.

I'm Ankush Sharma, a
Solutions Architect at AWS.
And today we'll be discussing
how IndiaMart successfully executed
their website translation use case on AWS.

Joining us is Mr. Vikram
Varshney from IndiaMart

who works as a vice
president at the company.
Vikram, thank you for being here
and agreeing to share your journey

of translating IndiaMart's
website using GenAI on AWS.
- Thank you for having me, Ankush.
- Right, let's begin with a brief
introduction about IndiaMart.
Could you please tell us what IndiaMart is
and what does it do?
- Absolutely.

So IndiaMart is India's
largest marketplace
connecting buyers and suppliers

and with the 60% market
share in the online

B2B classified space,
IndiaMart focuses on providing
platform for small and medium enterprises,
which in short is called SMEs,
large enterprises and individuals.
We have over 8 million suppliers,

180 million buyers
across 98,000 categories
and over a hundred million products
and services listed on the platform.
- Well thank you for the overview, Vikram.

Now let's dive into Indic
language translation use case.

Tell us what problem
were you trying to solve
and how would it have help your business?
- So traditionally IndiaMart was always,
or rather only available in English,

which is catering to primarily
the tier one city users.
However, we noticed a significant shift
with our 60% traffic coming from tier two

and tier three cities with
the onset of mobile internet.
These regions expanded and the trend
we are seeing is accelerating.

To better engage with
these growing user base,
we recognize the need to offer the content
in languages they prefer,

and India is diverse
and incredibly diverse
with a strong demand for content,

particularly in Indian
languages like Tamil, Telugu,
Marathi, Bengali, Kannada.

So we were expanding our
language offering to the users.

We aimed to increase engagement,
boost conversion rates,

and solidify IndiaMart as
go-to platform for businesses
and buyers across the country.
Additionally, this move helps us in SEO
making us more visible in search engines
and driving traffic.
To achieve this, we implemented a robust

translation mechanism for our
a hundred million products,
ensuring both new in incoming
as well as updated content is accessible
in multiple languages,

which will be fueling our
growth in these key markets.
- Fascinating.

Now please tell us how
did you start your journey
and what ultimately solved your problem?
- So we began with a proof of concept
where we provided Hindi content

along with the English
version on the same platform.
The POC was quite promising,

but it didn't fulfill the
expectation in terms of accuracy
or effectively reaching to the broader
Hindi speaking audience.

And like the advent of
large language models

and generative AI, the
content translation technology
itself was revolutionized.

These technologies are
right now so sophisticated
that they understand where to translate,

where to concentrate, how to
handle the language nuances.

So we partnered with AWS to
explore our LLM based approach,

leveraging techniques
like prompt engineering,

few-shot learning to enhance
our accuracy of translation

even with limited data center
available in the market.
This all in all led to Amazon Bedrock

where ultimately we solved
our problem by enabling

and creating highly
accurate Hindi content.

This success allowed us to
launch a dedicated platform
called Hindi.Indiamart.com

which is specifically
and dedicatedly targeted

to our Hindi speaking
and writing audiences.
- Excellent.

And how did Amazon Bedrock
solve your problem?
- So Amazon Bedrock offers a wide choice

of foundation models
from leading AI companies

like AI21, Anthropic,
Meta, Cohere, Mistral,

Stability and Amazon themselves
in a single platform.

These are easy to access
APIs based models,
which helped us quickly evaluate

and choose the best suited
one for our use case.

The selection criteria
was around accuracy.

AWS also helped us by engaging
a GenAI competence partner
who quickly did A POC for us.

And after comparing the
output from various models,
we finalized Anthropics Claude 3 Sonnet
as the best suited choice for us,
providing an accuracy of more than 90%.

And Bedrock being a managed
service also took away
a lot of undifferentiating heavy lifting
of the infrastructure of elements
which would've taken months for us.

And we launched Hindi.IndidMart.com
with 500,000 products

and we plan to incrementally
add rest of the products
leading up to hundred million products
in total in this language.
Similarly, we plan to launch domains

for other five languages
in near future as well.
- That's impressive.

Now tell us, did Amazon
Bedrock also address
your data security and privacy concerns?
- Oh yes.

Security and privacy
is a big concern for us
or rather all the players.
And same was the case with IndiaMart.

As we are the guardian of
lot of PII data of our users.

Amazon provides us foundation
models through Amazon Bedrock,
which are hosted and managed
by AWS in the AWS manage accounts.

So there is no access allowed
to the model providers,

customer data stored in the
model deployment accounts

and data is never shared
with model providers
to train their base models.

As this data is customer owned,
it is not also accessible
to the AWS service teams.

So all these and many
other security measures

addressed our data security
and privacy concerns.
- Well that's reassuring, Vikram.

Please also tell us
what were the challenges
you encountered along the way?

- So when we started, we found
accuracy related challenges
with traditional translation models,

which were not giving
us the desired outcome

due to their inability
to maintain context,

understand the linguistic
nuances during the translation.

These were the concerns
around data security.
There were also data security issues.
However, with LLM's, which were hosted
in a fully secured environment,
we could overcome these challenges

by benefiting from LLM's
ability to maintain context

and using few-shot learning
to instruct the model
to translate in the desired manner.
- Well, okay.

Thank you very much Vikram
for your time and insights.
It's been a pleasure talking to you

and learning about IndiaMart's
GenAI journey on AWS.
We look forward to supporting you
in your continued GenAI journey.
- Thank you so much.

And before concluding, I would
like to inform the viewers

that like IndiaMart, you can
also start your GenAI journey
on AWS using Amazon Bedrock
and you can find the relevant links
in the description of this video.
Thank you very much.
